1: <sup>1</sup> Bow down thine ear, O LORD, hear me: for I am poor and needy.
2: <sup>2</sup> Preserve my soul; for I am holy: O thou my God, save thy servant that trusteth in thee.
3: <sup>3</sup> Be merciful unto me, O Lord: for I cry unto thee daily.
4: <sup>4</sup> Rejoice the soul of thy servant: for unto thee, O Lord, do I lift up my soul.
5: <sup>5</sup> For thou, Lord, art good, and ready to forgive; and plenteous in mercy unto all them that call upon thee.
6: <sup>6</sup> Give ear, O LORD, unto my prayer; and attend to the voice of my supplications.
7: <sup>7</sup> In the day of my trouble I will call upon thee: for thou wilt answer me.
8: <sup>8</sup> Among the gods there is none like unto thee, O Lord; neither are there any works like unto thy works.
9: <sup>9</sup> All nations whom thou hast made shall come and worship before thee, O Lord; and shall glorify thy name.
10: <sup>10</sup> For thou art great, and doest wondrous things: thou art God alone.
11: <sup>11</sup> Teach me thy way, O LORD; I will walk in thy truth: unite my heart to fear thy name.
12: <sup>12</sup> I will praise thee, O Lord my God, with all my heart: and I will glorify thy name for evermore.
13: <sup>13</sup> For great is thy mercy toward me: and thou hast delivered my soul from the lowest hell.
14: <sup>14</sup> O God, the proud are risen against me, and the assemblies of violent men have sought after my soul; and have not set thee before them.
15: <sup>15</sup> But thou, O Lord, art a God full of compassion, and gracious, longsuffering, and plenteous in mercy and truth.
16: <sup>16</sup> O turn unto me, and have mercy upon me; give thy strength unto thy servant, and save the son of thine handmaid.
17: <sup>17</sup> Shew me a token for good; that they which hate me may see it, and be ashamed: because thou, LORD, hast holpen me, and comforted me.
